meanings.def: at an equal distance between two points; in the middle of a period of time
examples: I got the ball on the halfway line.

meanings.def: part of the way towards doing or achieving something
at an equal distance between two points; in the middle of a period of time
examples: It's about halfway between London and Bristol.
He left halfway through the ceremony.
I'm afraid we're not even halfway there yet.

meanings.def: part of the way towards doing or achieving something
examples: This only goes halfway to explaining what really happened.
Any halfway decent map will give you that information.

meanings.def: to reach an agreement with somebody by giving them part of what they want
examples: If he was prepared to apologize, the least she could do was meet him halfway and accept some of the blame.

idioms.def: to reach an agreement with somebody by giving them part of what they want
examples: If he was prepared to apologize, the least she could do was meet him halfway and accept some of the blame.
